title: Impact Of Plastic Straws On Marine Wildlife And Birds - Wheels For Wishes
body: Plastic straws are just one of several plastic pollutants used globally, but eliminating them is a great step toward solving a global epidemic. How Plastic Straws Affect Ocean Ecosystems. Plastic straws never fully break down and have no way of biodegrading or dissolving. In the United States alone, 500 million straws are used every day.
readable_content:
Anonymous (2023-12-08): Plastic straw pollution has made waves in the news recently, with widespread environmental impact. This disposable item, used globally and found in most drinks at restaurants, has been accumulating in oceans, negatively affecting marine wildlife and birds. Plastic straws don't break down and produce microplastics. These harmful particles are ingested by animals, presenting a significant threat. To combat this, small lifestyle changes, such as using alternative, environmentally-friendly straws, can help save marine ecosystems.

Additionally, car donation programs like Wheels For Wishes have a positive impact on the environment by recycling vehicle donations, with the proceeds benefiting children facing critical illness through Make-A-Wish. Donating an unwanted car can support this mission to make the world a better place and have a significant impact on local Make-A-Wish chapters.

- With this in mind, you can donate a car to Wheels For Wishes today by calling 1-855-278-9474 or by filling out their online donation form.
